Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black (fired reddish-brown); exterior: from top, part of two lines; below, incised chain of lotuses with added red on kalyxes and palmettes with red on cuffs.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.555.b-e. For parallels, see Payne 1931, 154, fig. 62. For examples of the lotus flower and palmette frieze pattern to separate friezes on Corinthian column-kraters, see the Sphortos Painter in Amyx 1988, 508, pl. 120.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.058) (Phase 1)
